poem:
"Perseverance in Polling Day Purgatory"

Inconspicuous amoeba, 
crawling into the belly of democracy
emerging with a cough - as persistent 
as Putin's rule.

She, an anomaly 
in the gullet of the state,
a vibrant flicker 
on the cold grey palette- 

hailed by the physician's wisdom
and condemned by politics,
A newspaper headline, but to us
- a brave stanza.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Digested week: This cough has lasted for ever – our amazing GP knows just what to do | Zoe Williams Monday It was unsurprising, to wake up to the news of a thumping election victory for Vladimir Putin, but there were people who did take the risk of voting the wrong way; some incredible footage showed one woman crawling like a marine into a polling booth, to avoid being identified. The independent newspaper Novaya Gazeta". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Digested week: This cough has lasted for ever – our amazing GP knows just what to do | Zoe Williams Monday It was unsurprising, to wake up to the news of a thumping election victory for Vladimir Putin, but there were people who did take the risk of voting the wrong way; some incredible footage showed one woman crawling like a marine into a polling booth, to avoid being identified. The independent newspaper Novaya Gazeta
